text: Village is an unincorporated community in Columbia County, Arkansas. ==History== A post office called Village was established in 1888, and remained in operation until 2002. An old variant name was "Machine". The origin of the name "Machine" is obscure. ==Education== Magnolia School District operates area public schools. The Village School District consolidated into the Magnolia district on July 1, 1986."ConsolidationAnnex_from_1983.xls." Arkansas Department of Education. Retrieved on October 13, 2017. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Columbia County, Arkansas Category:Unincorporated communities in Arkansas
title: Village, Arkansas
